action.content:
You are a language wizard who likes to guess words by using the given rules.

Welcome to Wordle! You have six attempts to guess the target word, a valid English word of five lowercase letters (a-z). Please use the tags "explanation:" and "guess:" to provide a concise explanation for each guess.

For instance, if your guess is "apple", your response should be
explanation: this is a common five-letter English word, and I am starting my guess with this word.
guess: apple

After each guess, your answer will be validated, and you will receive feedback indicating which letters are correct (green), which letters are correct but in the wrong position (yellow), and which letters are incorrect (red). This feedback can be useful in determining which letters to include or exclude in your next guess.

For example, the feedback for "apple" might be:
guess_feedback: a<yellow> p<yellow> p<green> l<yellow> e<red>

The explanation should contain details about how the guess_feedback is used to arrive at a new guess.

Do not generate any other text.

Let's begin with your first guess.

explanation: This is a common five-letter English word with a mix of frequently used consonants and vowels, making it a good starting point.
guess: crate

attempts = 1
target_word = using
guess = crate
guess_feedback = c<red> r<red> a<red> t<red> e<red>

guess_feedback: c<red> r<red> a<red> t<red> e<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: Since all letters in "crate" were incorrect, I will try a completely different set of letters, focusing on other common consonants and vowels.
guess: bloom

attempts = 2
target_word = using
guess = bloom
guess_feedback = b<red> l<red> o<red> o<red> m<red>

guess_feedback: b<red> l<red> o<red> o<red> m<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: All letters in "bloom" were incorrect as well, so I will now try another set of common letters, avoiding those already marked as incorrect.
guess: shiny

attempts = 3
target_word = using
guess = shiny
guess_feedback = s<yellow> h<red> i<green> n<green> y<red>

guess_feedback: s<yellow> h<red> i<green> n<green> y<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: The feedback indicates that "i" and "n" are correct and in the right positions, while "s" is correct but misplaced. I will now form a new word that keeps "i" and "n" fixed and moves "s" to a different position.
guess: snail

attempts = 4
target_word = using
guess = snail
guess_feedback = s<yellow> n<yellow> a<red> i<yellow> l<red>

guess_feedback: s<yellow> n<yellow> a<red> i<yellow> l<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: The feedback shows that "s," "n," and "i" are correct but misplaced. I will now rearrange these letters while avoiding "a" and "l," which were marked as incorrect.
guess: sinew

attempts = 5
target_word = using
guess = sinew
guess_feedback = s<yellow> i<yellow> n<yellow> e<red> w<red>

guess_feedback: s<yellow> i<yellow> n<yellow> e<red> w<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: The feedback confirms that "s," "i," and "n" are correct but still misplaced. I will try a new arrangement of these letters, ensuring no repeated mistakes.
guess: spins

attempts = 6
target_word = using
guess = spins
guess_feedback = s<yellow> p<red> i<green> n<green> s<red>

guess_explanation: This is a common five-letter English word with a mix of frequently used consonants and vowels, making it a good starting point.
Since all letters in "crate" were incorrect, I will try a completely different set of letters, focusing on other common consonants and vowels.
All letters in "bloom" were incorrect as well, so I will now try another set of common letters, avoiding those already marked as incorrect.

The feedback indicates that "i" and "n" are correct and in the right positions, while "s" is correct but misplaced. I will now form a new word that keeps "i" and "n" fixed and moves "s" to a different position.
The feedback shows that "s," "n," and "i" are correct but misplaced. I will now rearrange these letters while avoiding "a" and "l," which were marked as incorrect.
The feedback confirms that "s," "i," and "n" are correct but still misplaced. I will try a new arrangement of these letters, ensuring no repeated mistakes.
